headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Germany: Party United As Coalition Wobbles

lead_paragraph: Chancellor Gerhard Schröder was re-elected leader of the Social Democratic Party with 88.6 percent of the vote at the party's congress, but his coalition with the Greens may be threatened at their party congress, which opens next weekend. The Green rank-and-file are unhappy with the government's decision to send troops to support the war in Afghanistan. Steven Erlanger (NYT)
